alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 26 at 11:30AM PST until November 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 11 inches in the Cascades and up to 4 inches in the Eastern Douglas County Foothills. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over the Cascades. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 2500 feet, South Central Oregon Cascades, and Southern Oregon Cascades from Howard Prairie Lake north. The Siskiyous are not included in this Advisory. Oregon highways 62, 138, 140, and 230 will be affected. * WHEN...From 4 PM Sunday to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will be heaviest Monday morning, when rates in the Cascades will approach 1 inch an hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
